description.narrative: Vulnerable and excluded children aged 6 to 16 years have increased support in terms of access to education and to high quality learning and professional training opportunities children are encouraged to continue with their schooling, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved care and learning opportunities promoting the survival, development and inclusion of children, especially those living in regions with high inequalities

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable and excluded children aged 6 to 16 years have increased support in terms of access to education and to high quality learning and professional training opportunities; children are encouraged to continue with their schooling

description.narrative: Access to quality education was enhanced with the generation of additional knowledge necessary to address exclusion and drop-out. The qualitative surveys conducted in2018 to better understand barriers to retention and completion of primary and secondary education was analyzed by the MoE and should contribute to the development, with UNICEF assistance or support? Maybe?, of a strategic response plan to address the drop-out phenomena. The assessment on life skills and citizenship education initiatives was finalized and is instrumental for advocating for education curriculum review. The World's Largest Lesson initiated globally with UNESCO was carried out in 20,000 basic education schools nationwide | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of evidence-generation products developed and used to improve inclusion and retention in school of OOSC
Service Delivery - Inclusive Ed. - Number of educational staff (excluding teachers) who received training with funding provided by UNICEF, see guidance
Number of children attending or going to school after reopening of schools with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Existence of national strategies to address inequities in education access, participation and retention - score (1-4), see guidance

title.narrative: Response plan developed and tested in the most disadvantaged districts
